moves.1. e4 e5 2. f4 exf4: A true gentleman always accepts a gambit! Especially when it's offered by an amateur to a master.
moves.3. b3: A horrible move. The correct move is 3 N-KB3, preventing once and for all Q-R5ch.
moves.4. g3: White has no good moves. K-K2 offers possibilities of fleeing to the Q-side [K-Q3 and K-B3], but White wouldn't last long with that move either. His King would be at the mercy of Black's pieces.
moves.4... fxg3: Threatening a nasty discovered check. If White tries PxP Goetz will simply take the unprotected KR.
moves.5. h3: As good or bad as anything else.
moves.5... g2+: If nothing else avails, Black can play PxR (Q) with an enormous material advantage.
moves.7... gxh1=N#: Calling for a second chess set, as he wishes to borrow a Black Knight, and also calling, "Checkmate!" Well done, Mr. Goetz.
